description: Number of i such that d(i)>=d(i-1), where Sum{d(i)*4^i: i=0,1,...,m} is base 4 representation of n.
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A037827 := proc(n)    a := 0 ;    dgs := convert(n,base,4);    for i from 2 to nops(dgs) do        if op(i,dgs)>=op(i-1,dgs) then            a := a+1 ;        end if;    end do:    a ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 16 2015S:= [1,2,3,6,7,11]:f:= proc(n) option remember;procname(floor(n/4)) + `if`(has(S,n mod 16),0,1)end proc:f(0):= 0:seq(f(n),n=1..100); # _Robert Israel_, Oct 16 2015
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {my(d = Vecrev(digits(n, 4))); my(dd = vector(#d-1, k, d[k+1] - d[k])); #select(x->(x>=0), dd);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 16 2015
